intro: Triplaris mato-grossensis, commonly known as the Mato Grosso triplaris, is a small evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
